brief_summary.textblock:
To determine the absolute bioavailability of the Lu AE58054 tablet formulation at steady
      state

clinical_study.brief_title: Absolute Bioavailability of Lu AE58054 in Healthy Subjects

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy men and women aged between 21-55 years (inclusive) and with an BMI in the
             range 18.5 to 32 kg/m2 (minimum weight 60 kg for men and 55 kg for women).

          -  The subjects CYP2D6 genotype must be determined before inclusion into the study.

          -  Women must not be pregnant or lactating.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  The subject is, in the opinion of the investigator, unlikely to comply with the
             protocol or is unsuitable for any reason.

        Other inclusion and exclusion criteria may apply.

intervention.description:
Oral dosing: 90 mg Lu AE58054 as a single dose once and after a 3 days washout period, once daily for 7 days.
Intravenous dosing: 90 μg/not more than (NMT) 1000 nCi/37 kBq 14C-Lu AE58054 for intravenous infusion once on Day 10.

clinical_study.official_title: Interventional, Open-label Study Investigating the Absolute Bioavailability of Lu AE58054 After Multiple Oral Dosing and a Single Radio-labelled Intravenous Micro-dose as Well as the Contribution of Cytochrome P450 2D6 to the Exposure of Lu AE58054 in Healthy Subjects

overall_official.last_name: Email contact via H. Lundbeck A/S

oversight_info.authority: United Kingdom: Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency

primary_outcome.measure: Absolute bioavailability: (AUC0-24) Dose oral/(AUC0-inf) Dose IV

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number and frequency of adverse events
Number of subjects with adverse events

secondary_outcome.description: Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS) categorisation based on Columbia Classification Algorithm of Suicide Assessment (C-CASA) definitions

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Bio-availability Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label
